amendatorysection.para: Any person having a judgment rendered by a district court may request the clerk of such court to issue execution on the judgment in the same manner as execution is issued upon other judgments rendered in the district court and direct the execution on the judgment to any county in the state. Such person may request that garnishment, attachment, or any other aid to execution for personal property or wages be directed to any county without the necessity of filing a transcript of the judgment in the receiving county, and any hearing or proceeding with regard to such execution or aid in execution shall be heard in the court in which the judgment was originally rendered. Such execution shall not serve as a lien on real estate in a county other than the county where the judgment was rendered unless a transcript of the judgment is filed with the clerk of the district court in the county in which the real estate is located.
